main event: Observers reported a flickering light that appeared bright white and changed to red and orange over Gambell, St. Lawrence Island, on multiple nights in March 1953.
interesting points: The light changed colors from bright white to shades of red and orange., It was observed at a true bearing of 323° from the observer., The initial altitude of the light was about 5° above the horizon., The duration of the sighting was 15 minutes, with similar lights observed on subsequent nights., The conclusion drawn was that the observed light was likely the astronomical body Venus.
sighted object: flickering light changing from white to red and orange
witness description: Observers located approximately 1 mile East of the village of Gambell.
